text: @realDonaldTrump You watching the CNN Special today GENOCIDE TRUMP on the Coronavirus victims? Very moving.  Maybe you should watch to see a small sampling of the pain you’ve caused by your inaction.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: The Situation Room
entity.description: "The Situation Room With Wolf Blitzer" is the command center for breaking news, politics and extraordinary reports from around the world. Patterned after the concept of the White House Situation Room, CNN's lead political anchor Wolf Blitzer hosts newsmakers and experts to discuss and analyze the stories that are driving today's news.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Inside Politics
entity.description: With veteran Washington correspondent John King in the anchor chair, "Inside Politics" focuses on the top political stories of the day with a rotating round table of top sourced reporters from CNN and from other media outlets. The half-hour program gives viewers an inside look at the stories driving Washington, directly from reporters on the ground. Prior to its revival in 2014, "Inside Politics" was first headed by Judy Woodruff, and it aired for more than 20 years on CNN before its cancellation in 2005.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Death Row Stories
entity.description: CNN is by and large still a cable news outlet, but a movement under the leadership of network president Jeff Zucker to provide more alternative, entertainment-based programming is clearly afoot, and "Death Row Stories" is a prime example. The documentary -- the result of a collaboration with Academy Award-winning directors Robert Redford ("Ordinary People") and Alex Gibney ("Taxi to the Dark Side") -- revisits compelling capital murder cases in the U.S., detailing the twists and turns involved in each as a thought-provoking exercise on the death penalty and the American justice system. Redford's Sundance Productions also partnered with CNN for the documentary series "Chicagoland."

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: State of the Union
entity.description: Hosted by CNN's chief Washington correspondent Jake Tapper and journalist Dana Bash, "State of the Union" features one-on-one interviews with top newsmakers on politics and policy. Often joined by a round table of expert guests, the Sunday morning program covers Washington, the country, and the world, and goes beyond the Beltway for a perspective on how everyday Americans are faring.

entity.name: The Hit That Wasn't
entity.description: CNN is by and large still a cable news outlet, but a movement under the leadership of network president Jeff Zucker to provide more alternative, entertainment-based programming is clearly afoot, and "Death Row Stories" is a prime example. Redford's Sundance Productions also partnered with CNN for the documentary series "Chicagoland."
